item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Commonplace Book
item.description: Software Examples Obsidian.md OneNote Notion Roam Research Devon Think What to look for in software: ability to connect and link notes, good search feature, text editing, tables, … (mobile app) This also helps feed your pattern recognition, curiosity, and thus feeds creativity, Flow, and skill building.

item.title: Creativity
item.description: What is it? .. the workings of creativity are the workings of the world. Creativity and Flow go together.

item.title: Distraction
item.description: Distractions are defined relative to where we The worst distractions are those we think are necessary, we can’t live without and aren’t leading us to where we’re set on going.

item.title: Flow
Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary ðŸ§ sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
